required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictors of Postoperative Complications and Readmissions in Laparoscopic Pancreas Resection
clinical_study.official_title: Predictors of Postoperative Complications and Readmissions in Laparoscopic Pancreas Resection: Results of 105 Consecutive Cases

lead_sponsor.agency: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

clinical_study.source: Clinica Universidad de Navarra, Universidad de Navarra

brief_summary.textblock: Laparoscopic resection of the pancreas has become widely accepted in the treatment of lesions which are benign or of low-grade malignancy. The objective of this study is to analyze the factors that predict postoperative complications and hospital readmission in a series of laparoscopic pancreatectomies.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators conducted a retrospective study using a prospective database of laparoscopic resections performed between 2000 and 2020. Data were collected on age, gender, body mass index (BMI), American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA) score, type of surgery, histologic type, operative time, hospital stay, postoperative complications, degree of severity and hospital readmission

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of Gender, Age, body mass index with the outcomes
primary_outcome.description: The investigators evaluate multiple variables in relation in the designed outcomes: Gender, Age, body mass index (weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2)
Readmission defined as an admission to any hospital for 24 hours or more for any reason within 60 days of surgery

intervention.description: Laparoscopic resection of the pancreas has become widely accepted in the treatment of lesions which are benign or of low-grade malignancy

study_pop.textblock: All consecutive patients undergoing laparoscopic resection of the pancreas between 2000 and 2020 in the Clínica Universidad de Navarra

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A retrospective study was carried out using data from a prospective database of all consecutive patients undergoing laparoscopic resection of the pancreas between 2000 and 2020 in the Clínica Universidad de Navarra
Exclusion Criteria:
- n/a
